G

gameLength - Variable in class com.snake.LevelController
Determines game length, is assigned the user's set game length setting at level setup when startButton is pressed
gameModel - Variable in class com.snake.LevelController
GameModel - Handles non-sprite information, stores user settings and scores between levels (see GameModel for more information).
gameModel - Variable in class com.snake.SettingsController
The current program instances' GameModel, which is used by settings to save the user's input and get the previously checked game length box, or default (medium) if the user hasn't checked a different box this run.
GameModel - Class in com.snake
Class stores data and is used to pass info (scores and settings) between scenes.
GameModel() - Constructor for class com.snake.GameModel
 
gameOver() - Method in class com.snake.LevelController
Ends the game, sends score to GameModel, switches to game over screen
GameOverController - Class in com.snake
Controls the end game screen - Image used in view is the one from the original codebase - Picture is correct size - Displays score, allows user to save if they scored high enough - If the user has won the game, they can pick Endless Mode from this screen.
GameOverController() - Constructor for class com.snake.GameOverController

Returns sprite boundary for collision check

Returns sprite direction
getCurrentLevel() - Method in class com.snake.GameModel
Gets the current level number, used by LevelController to know which sprites to spawn and how fast the snake's head should move and by SpriteModel to know how fast to move the snake's body
getCurrentScore() - Method in class com.snake.GameModel
Gets the current score for display in new level
getDarkFlag() - Method in class com.snake.GameModel
Gets the user's dark mode setting
getEndGameScore() - Method in class com.snake.GameModel
Returns the score set by setEndGameScore() in order to compare it with stored scores and place it on the leaderboard if it is high enough
getFilePath() - Method in class com.snake.GameModel
The path to the high scores file
getFollowing() - Method in class com.snake.SpriteModel
Gets the preceding sprite in the snake's body, which is the one this is following
getInsertIndex(ArrayList<String>) - Method in class com.snake.GameModel
Tests whether the score can be written to the file: If it can't, returns -1; If the file is empty, returns -2 which will be used to place the score at the top of the leaderboard; If it can be written and scores already are present returns the index of where to place the current player's score
getPlayerName() - Method in class com.snake.GameModel
Gets the player's name
getPosX() - Method in class com.snake.SpriteModel
Gets current X position of the sprite
getPosY() - Method in class com.snake.SpriteModel
Gets current Y position of the sprite
getScoresFromFile() - Method in class com.snake.GameModel
Reads names and scores from file and returns them as an ArrayList, used both for setScoresToFile's sorting and index calculation and for HighScoreController to display the current 9 high scores to the user
getSoundFlag() - Method in class com.snake.GameModel
Gets the user's sound setting
